overview.name: Vogue China digital editor
overview.description: Vogue Chinas new digital editor, Margaret Zhang, born in Austrialia, a writer and photgrapher based out of New York and Shenghi. Zhang currently lives in Sydney, has lived in New York for the past five years, and visits China every other month. She plans to move to Beijing once the pandemic subsides.

overview.name: Overarching Print Magazine Editors
overview.description: Overarching Print Magazine Editors: Editor-in-Chief: Edward Enninful, Managing Editor: Mark Russell, Fashion & Accessories Editor: Donna Wallace, Merchandise Editor: Helen Hibbird, Beauty & Lifestyle Editor: Lauren Murdoch-Smith, Features Editor: Olivia Marks. British Vogue has six editors that cover each large segment of the magazine. The Editor-in-Chief, Edward Enninful, is from Ghana. Managing Editor, Mark Russell, Merchandise Editor, Helen Hibbird, and Features Editor Olivia Marks are all from London. The Fashion & Accessories Editor, Donna Wallace is from Nottingham, England and the Beauty & Lifestyle Editor, Lauren Murdoch-Smith is from Watford, England. All of these editors are UK natives with the exception of Edward Enninful who moved to London with his family at the age of 13.

overview.name: Monthly Unique Visitors
overview.description: Every month the British Vogue Magazine website has 10.6 million unique visitors. Although they are presumably not all from the UK, that's over 15 percent of the UK population.

overview.name: Most Iconic Cover Models
overview.description: The five most iconic British Vogue covers feature Donyale Luna from Detroit, Michigan, Helmut Berger from Austria, Lady Diana Spencer from Sandringham, UK, Kate Middleton the Duchess of Cambridge from Reading, UK, and Zayn Malik from Bradford, UK. In March 1966, Donyale Luna became the first person of color to be on a Vogue cover. In July 1970, Helmut Berger became the first man to star on the cover of Vogue. In August 1981, Lady Diana Spencer, soon to be the Princess of Wales, was on the Vogue cover. For British Vogue's 100th anniversary, Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Camebridge made the June 2016 cover. The first ever digital cover starred Zayn Malik in December 2019.

overview.name: Sales Volume 2018
overview.description: In 2018, British Vogue sold 144,580 copies of the print magazine. This was .04% of the total magazine sales in the UK for that year, which came in at 370 million copies sold.

overview.name: Exclusively Digital Editors Education
overview.description: British Vogue has six editors that work exclusively with their digital content (website). They are Executive Digital Editor Kerry McDermott, Digital Beauty Editor Hannah Coates, Senior Digital News Editor Alice Newbold, Digital Fashion writer Alice Cary, Digital Picture Editor & Content Producer Parveen Narowalia, and Video Editor & Post-Production Co-ordinator Jessica Vincent. Each went to university in London, with the exception of Hannah Coates, who studied in Birmingham, England and Kerry McDermott who studied in Nottingham.

overview.name: April 2021 Cover Models
overview.description: Achenrin Madit from South Sudan, Precious Lee from Atlanta, GA, Janaye Furman from Altadena, CA, and Mona Tougaard from Aarhus, Denmark all starred on British Vogue's April 2021 covers. With these covers, the magazine hoped to convey and celebrate Black joy in light of current racial injustices in the world.

overview.name: Print Magazine Paper
overview.description: Vogue uses Galerie Fine Gloss 80gsm paper in its print magazines which is made by a Finnish company called M-Real. M-Real is headquartered in Espoo, Finland, with mills in Kirkniemi, Finland and Husum, Sweden.

overview.name: Print Magazine Paper

overview.name: Print Magazine Printing/ Production
overview.description: At the start of 2019, Conde Nast, the mother company of Vogue and subsequently British Vogue, signed over 100% of its magazine printing and production to Quad/Graphics Inc. is a company based in Sussex, Wisconsin. Quad/Graphics Inc.'s European printing locations are in Wyszkow and Radzymin, Poland. Quad/Graphics Inc. also handles distribution and mailing for Conde Nast's magazines.

overview.name: YouTube Channel
overview.description: While Vogue Magazine has an overarching YouTube channel recorded in English, British Vogue has its own YouTube channel as well. The British Vogue channel is averaging 6.2 million views per month in 2021. The channel, started in February, 2013, has 502 videos, 203,149,345 total views, and 1.05 million subscribers as of April 2021.

overview.name: iPad App
overview.description: Vogue's first ever app was developed as an iPad app under British Vogue in 2010. It was overseen by London native Alexandra Shulman, the Editor in Chief at the time, spearheaded by the Art Director Robin Derrick from Bristol, England, and edited by Dolly Jones from County Tyrone, Northern Ireland. The app was relatively unintegrated at the time, but led the way for all of the Vogue apps availiable today.

overview.name: Cost of the cover to produce
overview.description: The cover itself is around $750 to produce.

overview.name: Salary of cover models
overview.description: $100 per hour if you are doing well but as little as $20 per hour if you aren't meeting the standards.

overview.name: Cost of an ad
overview.description: Vogue holds one of the most expensive ad prices amoungst other similar magazines.

overview.name: Featured celebrity couples
overview.description: There have only been 2 featured celebrity couples on the cover one including Kim and Kanye

overview.name: September 2012 Lady Gaga
overview.description: The Lady Gaga Septmeber 2012 edition of Vogue is the largest printed magazine with 916 pages.

overview.name: September Vogue
overview.description: September Vogue is essentially the most important becuase it marks the end of summer and begins a season of routine for people. This has been true for 114 years of Vogue.

overview.name: 73 Questions
overview.description: "73 rapid questions for the most A-list celebrities, shot in one clip ""single shot"" video. last updated on Mar24, 2021 production - CondeNast Entertainment . ""73 Questions with Anna Wintour | Vogue + Vogue's Editor in Chief. Filmed in New York on September 10, 2014 Created by Joe Sabia Director of Photography: Vincent Peone Production Company: Original Media "" """"""Why 73 questions?"""" """"It’s 73 because I initially planned for 100 questions, but pulling that off in one take (yes, these are really shot in one take) felt a bit risky. So, I settled on 73 because it was a prime number, looked unusual, and had great SEO."""""" ""73 Questions With Blake Lively | Vogue - July 23, 2014 Created by: Joe Sabia Director of Photography: Vincent Peone Produced By: Original Media Food Stylist: Judy Kim http://www.thejudylab.com/​ Photographer: Jacqueline M. Koh Shot on location at thekitchentablenyc.com"""

overview.name: Vogue Beauty Secrets
